column6: Refund and withdraw could be automatic after exercised or expiry

Missing floor token transfer for short call

Low liquidity, no way to resell the opened position
onERC721Received() could delegatecall to transder the tokens
Don't check if `value` is 0 for some paths
Functions have payable modifier but dont do anything with the ether
Fees are taken on unexercised put options and not taken on exercised put options
Long whitelist could cause out of gas error
Shorter can prevent the longer from exercising the option by adding a malicious asset to the order
The contract serves as a flashloan pool without fee
Potential fund loss for direct ETH transfers with non-WETH baseAsset
Contract can make taker spend unbounded gas if baseAsset is ERC777
fillOrder() can be DoSed with lack of token approvals

validate that msg.value is 0 when it should be

Royalty can't be collected. You may face serious lawsuit from blue chip NFTs once you have been famous.

Unconventional design of option expiration time design and lack of validation making it possible for the taker to buy a long position that can not be exercised
return value of weth transfer is ignored and unchecked
both order side positions don’t exist  is not checked

PUT short option is always in loss

Zero premium allows to steal from users
no protection from sending eth accidently
Some scenarios don't require paying fees
setBaseURI and setFee are payable for no reason
orders can be cancelled at any time

floor tokens contracts can have duplicates

missing check of the non-existence of both order sides positions in fillOrder
not checking TokenIds of new order against originalOrder in acceptCounter

Zero amount in order.erc20Assets lead to DOS
lack of validating transfer of WETH

`batchFillOrder.fillOrder()` `WETH.deposit()` wont work if  user uses native ETH instead of WETH to pay for more than one order
`batchFillOrder.fillOrder()` `msg.value` checks will revert if  user uses native ETH instead of WETH to pay for more than one order
A user might have 2 filled orders unexpectedly by canceling an already filled order.

An attacker(order maker) might make the sender can't withdraw tokens using vulnerable tokens.
Ensure zero msg.value if transferring from user and baseAsset is not WETH.

Native ETH can be sent with ERC20 orders
Underlying assets may be modified during execution
Putty position tokens may be minted to non ERC721 receivers
Fees not sent to admin/DAO in some condition
Use of Solidity version 0.8.13 which has two known issues applicable to PuttyV2
The strike cover amount can be locked for very long time in the putty contract
Zero strike call options can be systemically used to steal premium from the taker
Any failure of a transfer invalidates the whole order, allowing for exercise blocking attacks
Native funds sent over with an order are lost when not used
Zero strike call options will avoid paying system fee
Miners can influence the value of block.timestamp to perform Maximal Extractable Value (MEV) attacks.
CALL() SHOULD BE USED INSTEAD OF TRANSFER() ON AN ADDRESS PAYABLE
Unbounded loops may cause `exercise()`s and `withdraw()`s to fail
Put option sellers can prevent exercise by specifying zero amounts, or non-existant tokens
`fillOrder()` and `exercise()` may lock Ether sent to the contract, forever
Put/call options may be lost if the maker/filler is unable to handle ERC-721 tokens
Makers may be unable to withdraw assets 'put' to them if the fee is zero
Lack of whitelist can introduce bait and switch scams
Malicious long options can be used by makers to DOS takers
batchFillOrder does not handle ETH premiums properly
Avoid transfer()/send() as reentrancy mitigations. |  the gas repricing of opcodes may break deployed contracts |
Locked funds :has payable function, but no withdrawal functionality. Therefore, the funds will be locked in contract.
manipulation of given supply through mint functionality | There is an absence of checks for the mint functionality which can lead to undesirable effects. |

Admin fee not retrievable by admin himself
Calling arbitrage ERC20 asset transfer is risky
Duplicate Order hash leads to unfilled order
block.timestamp is not reliable and leads to wrong expiration time.
Fee transfer can fail for some tokens, causing withdraw to fail
Airdrops forever stuck in the contract
ERC20 tokens with Fee-on-transfer logic are not supported
Cannot create short call floorToken option

[M-01] Fees can change during the order life-cycle
[M-02] Cancel is allowed even after the order was filled
[H-02] Owner does not get any fee when call is expired
Attacker may front-run `acceptCounterOffer()` cause users to take both original order and new one
Attacker can take premium from taker who fill short-call orders for free.
`cancel()` function does not check if the order already was filled at some point.
logic check for msg.value in fillOrder() is broken
logic check for msg.value in exercise() is broken
An attacker can make a scam with an  option that uses a real NFT but can't be exercised.
An attacker can force a flash loan and get temporary ownership of any NFT held inside putty and perform arbitrary logic with it.
setBaseURI() and setFee() functions are payable but don't perform any logic on assets
Fake orders can be created for non existant tokens
Weak `msg.value` checks in `fillOrder`  can make users lose ETH
Funds may be stuck when using a contract
`fee` can change without the consent of users
`order.maker` can arbitrarily revoke its approval to cancel its signed orders.
[PNM-001] `short call` order with `order.floorTokens` non-empty will freeze users' funds
Emitting cancel event for filled orders
ETH might get locked in the contract
Not blocking fee-on-transfer tokens entirely can result in a loss of funds
The order maker can cancel the order, after it has been filled.
withdraw of assets batch could be blocked with one asset with malicious code
withdraw() could be blocked if feeAmount would be 0 and baseAsset contract doesn’t allow for zero amount transfers
Fee could be zero and reverts on transfer
Multiple orders compared in the loop with msg.value leads to loss of funds or transaction failures
Order cancellation is prone to frontrunning and is dependent on a centralized database
instead of call() , transfer() is used to withdraw the ether
Returned Value not checked when Depositing Eth
ETH can be sent to the contract accidentally and there is no way to get it back out
ERC721 asset can be put into ERC20 field of order and is lost on `withdraw` after Exercised Long Put
Short Put buyer can use ERC721 asset in multiple orders to receive more premiums
`PuttyV2`  `fillOrder` and `exercise` don't prevent ETH to be stuck
Some orders can be exercised without paying fees. Fee collect logic is not consistent with specification.
Payable functions are not thoroughly checked. ETH can get stuck in the contract.
Users can cancel irrelevant orders which do not exist
Protocol does not make any fees on unexercised options
Lack of two-step procedure for transferring ownership is error prone
Contract non-existence not checked before ERC 20 and ERC 721 transfers - can cause loss of funds due to all transfers succeeding for those contracts
asset can be stucked in the contract if transfer 0 fee
wrong comparision between `block.timestamp` and `positionExpirations` in `withdraw` function

Attacker can steal other users funds by signing malicious orders which looks profitable and tricking users (or by mistake) to call fillOrder(), the malicious order transfers PuttyV2 NFT token position of caller to attacker

It's possible to Use all PuttyV2 ERC20 and ERC721 token balances as free flash-loan by reentrancy in fillOrder() when filling specially crafted order (calling exercise() before fillOrder() collatral transfer)
In fillOrder() code uses mint() function instead of safeMint() which can cause tokens to be lost if the destination contract couldn't handle ERC721 tokens
There is no proposal + time-lock for admin/DAO operation in setBaseURI() and setFee()

Contract allows to create orders with duration=0 but it's not possible to immediately exercise or withdraw those orders after filling because of strict expiration condition for positionExpirations (in general when block.timestamp==positionExpirations it's not possible to exercise or withdraw order)

block.timestamp is used for expiration of orders and positions in fillOrder, exercise and  withdraw which can create MEV and miners can cause griefing and DOS for other user's transactions by manipulating block.timestamp

The code don't use nonce to identify orders, instead it uses order hash which is not best practice and could cause some issues like: duplicate nonce for different orders, can't quickly identify cancelled orders without order's all info, can't cancel multiple orders, can't cancel order without knowing order's all parameters
maker can perform griefing attack for taker by front-running fillOrder() call and removing allowance or in signature check for contract(ERC1271)
It's possible to cancel orders after they are filled and exercised which would make contract storage state to be in contradiction state
Fund lose because of contract logic don't consider deflationary tokens when transferring funds and there is no whitelist to validate supported tokens
fund steal by crating a lot of bad long positions and then transferring NFT token of long position to all users and trick them(or by mistake) to click on exercise()
Problems with the access control of the fillOrder() function
Using SafeTransferLib as a transfer medium has a certain probability of causing problems

Option Cannot Be Exercised Due To Unbounded Array Within An Order

Payable Function `exercise()` Allows For Native ETH Transfer Causing Ether To Be Stuck

Lack Of 0 Amount Check Allows Malicious User To Create Large Number Of Orders
Not-yet-exist ERC20 Could Be Used Within An Order
Incorrect EIP-712 Encoding For Array Within An Order
Rebase And Fee-on-transfer Tokens Not Explicitly Blocked
Fee is being deducted when Put is expired and not when it is exercised.
The fee is not paid as intended for put orders
Create a short call order with non empty floor makes the option impossible to exercise and withdraw
Create a short put order with zero tokenAmount makes the option impossible to exercise
When ETH is sent with `fillOrder` and `exercise` functions, the ETH can be lost
